banner.text: You're going to animate a sticker by looping through three different pictures. Click 'Add part' to get started.

tooltips.text: Add a Sticker to your app

banner.text: Drag the variable block into your code.
Connect it to the first list input.
Change the first value from animals to vehicles
Grab another of the same sticker blocks.
Connect it to the second list input.
Change the second input to Fire engine.
one more time. Open the sticker tray again.
Grab a third of the same sticker blocks.
Connect it to the third list input.
This time, set the sticker to Police car.
Drag the set item block onto your code space.
Drag the simple number block into your code.
Connect it beneath your last block.
This will be the animation loop that flips between sticker pictures. Change seconds to frames.
Change this number so the loop runs every 10 frames.
Grab this block. It will add one to the variable every time the code loops.
Time for some logic. Open the tray.
Grab this block. It returns the value of the variable.
Plug it into the left input of your logic check.
Plug it into the right input in your logic check.
Now if the number stored in the variable is greater than 3, the code in this block will run.
Connect it inside the if statement.
Connect it to the set variable block.
Connect it beneath the if block.
Grab this block. It’s for getting back things you stored in the list.
Connect it to the sticker input.
Drag the <kano-blockly-block type="variables_get"></kano-blockly-block> block onto your code space.
Connect it to the left input of the in list get block.
Connect it to the right input of the in list get block.

Wow! That's some tricky coding.
Can you make it go faster?
In the next challenge, you'll learn how to animate a car driving across the canvas.
